pack.hamster.name: Hamster's GunpowderRevolution_gunpack
pack.hamster.desc: Rediscover the revolutionary creations forgotten from the age of imperialism.
hamster.oldworkbench.desc:
An outdated wooden workbench
Inscribed with a marking from the early 20th century
hamster.ammo.compact_ammo.name: Short Bullet
hamster.ammo.medium_ammo.name: Medium Bullet
hamster.ammo.long_ammo.name: Long Bullet
hamster.ammo.flares_ammo.name: Flare Ammunition
hamster.attachment.loading_pipe.name: Quick Loading Tube
hamster.attachment.loading_pipe.desc:
Allows quick reloading using a loading tube,
suitable for tubular magazine rifles
hamster.attachment.speedloader.name: Speedloader
hamster.attachment.speedloader.desc:
Fast reload for revolvers
§cDiscards live rounds
hamster.attachment.drum_mag.name: Drum Magazine
hamster.attachment.drum_mag.desc:
High-capacity for auto pistols
§cHeavy and unreliable
hamster.attachment.gew98_scope.name: "Larsenau" Sniper Scope
hamster.attachment.gew98_scope.desc: A scope for the Gew98 rifle
hamster.attachment.lebel1886_scope.name: "Saint-Étienne" A.PX.1916 Sniper Scope
hamster.attachment.lebel1886_scope.desc: A scope for the Lebel M1886 rifle
hamster.attachment.unertl_scope.name: Unertl 8X Scope
hamster.attachment.puscope.name: PU Scope
hamster.attachment.ppco_scope.name: PPco Scope
hamster.attachment.aperture_sight.name: Aperture Sight
hamster.attachment.aperture_sight.desc: Peep sight for Winchester M1873 rifle
hamster.attachment.bayonetm1886.name: M1886 Bayonet
hamster.attachment.bayonetm1886.desc: A bayonet for the Lebel M1886 rifle
hamster.attachment.bayonet9805.name: M1898/05 a/A Bayonet
hamster.attachment.bayonet9805.desc: A bayonet for the Gew98 rifle
hamster.attachment.m9130_bayonet.name: Mosin M91/30 Bayonet
hamster.attachment.m9130_bayonet.desc: A bayonet for the Mosin-Nagant M91/30 rifle
hamster.attachment.bayonetp1903.name: P1903 Bayonet
hamster.attachment.bayonetp1903.desc: A bayonet for the Lee-Enfield rifle
hamster.attachment.bayonettype30.name: Type 30 Bayonet
hamster.attachment.bayonettype30.desc: A bayonet for the Type 99 rifle
hamster.attachment.rifle_grip.name: Rifle Grip
hamster.attachment.rifle_grip.desc: A more comfortable grip for the rifle
hamster.attachment.rifle_bipod.name: Rifle Bipod
hamster.attachment.rifle_bipod.desc: A bipod that stabilizes the rifle for more accurate continuous fire
hamster.attachment.gas_tube.name: Gas Piston Conversion
hamster.attachment.gas_tube.desc: Converts the rifle to a semi-automatic by drilling holes in the barrel
hamster.attachment.trench_mag.name: Trench Rifle Magazine
hamster.attachment.trench_mag.desc:
Designed for close combat in trenches,
greatly increases the rifle's capacity
hamster.attachment.deadeye_scope.name: “Deadeye” Scope
hamster.gun.colt1873_lb.name: §e“Angel Eye”
hamster.gun.colt1873_lb.desc:
Performing a precise and elegant lethal shot through the ultra-long barrel of a rifle
§e
hamster.gun.coltm1851_chain.name: Colt M1851 Bullet Chain Revolver
hamster.gun.coltm1851_chain.desc: Linked belt feed for higher ammo capacity.
hamster.gun.flaregun.name: Webley Flare Gun
hamster.gun.flaregun.desc: A large-caliber, single-shot flare gun by Webley
hamster.gun.sw_mk2.name: S&W.455 MKII
hamster.gun.sw_mk2.desc:
A short-barreled double-action revolver using .455 Webley ammo.
§eI hate snakes.
hamster.gun.coltm1892.name: Colt M1892 'New Army' Revolver
hamster.gun.coltm1892.desc:
The U.S. military's first double-action revolver. 
§eSlightly underpowered.
hamster.gun.makarov.name: Makarov PM Pistol
hamster.gun.makarov.desc:
Standard Soviet military/police sidearm. 
§eThe best compact Cold War pistol.
hamster.gun.win1873.name: Winchester M1873 Lever-Action Rifle
hamster.gun.win1873.desc:
The cowboy's classic - 'The Gun that Won the West.' 
§e'Just pour it on their heads.'
hamster.gun.m1garand.name: M1 Garand Rifle
hamster.gun.m1garand.desc:
First standard-issue semi-auto rifle
§eGave US forces overwhelming firepower.
hamster.gun.coltm1892pair.name: Micah's Sidearms
hamster.gun.nagantcarbine.name: Nagant M1895 Carbine
hamster.gun.nagantm1895.name: Nagant M1895 Revolver
hamster.gun.nagantm1895.desc:
Excellent gas seal, rugged & reliable. 
§eGreat for trigger finger training.
hamster.gun.krag.name: Krag-Jørgensen Rifle
hamster.gun.krag.desc:
Unique side-loading integral magazine
§eReloading is its only competitive edge.
hamster.gun.auto5.name: Browning Auto-5 Shotgun
hamster.gun.auto5.desc:
First mass-produced semi-auto shotgun
§eNicknamed 'Humpback' for its distinct shape.
hamster.gun.madsen.name: Madsen Light Machine Gun
hamster.gun.madsen.desc:
The first practical light machine gun, widely adopted for its performance.
§eA timeless classic still in use.
hamster.gun.mosin9130.name: Mosin-Nagant M91/30 Rifle
hamster.gun.mosin9130.desc:
A Russian rifle with a crisp sound when firing,
§eits use by revolutionaries marks its impact
hamster.gun.mosin91.name: Mosin-Nagant M1891
hamster.gun.mosin91.desc:
Imperial Russia's service rifle with distinctive firing sound
§eHer successors made her legendary.
hamster.gun.sks.name: SKS Semi-Automatic Rifle
hamster.gun.sks.desc:
A semi-automatic rifle designed by Simonov, already outdated at its inception.
§eUsed by people in third-world countries to break chains.
hamster.gun.mp18.name: MP18 Submachine Gun
hamster.gun.mp18.desc:
The first submachine gun used in large-scale warfare, called the 'bullet sprayer'.
§eThe Emperor’s blade in the hands of “Sturmtruppen”.
hamster.attachment.sks_bayonet.name: SKS Bayonet
hamster.attachment.sks_bayonet.desc: A folding bayonet designed for the SKS rifle.
hamster.gun.type99.name: Type 99 Rifle
hamster.gun.type99.desc:
A rifle designed for long-range precision shooting.
§eIts evolution reflects the rise and fall of the Empire
hamster.gun.m1903.name: Springfield M1903A1 Rifle
hamster.gun.m1903.desc:
A copy of the German Gew98, known for its precision and flat trajectory.
§eAfter the Spanish-American War, Americans wanted their own Mauser rifle.
hamster.gun.smle_mk3.name: Lee-Enfield No.1 MKIII Rifle
hamster.gun.smle_mk3.desc:
Known for rapid fire with a unique "mad minute",
§enot a machine gun, but a group of Lee-Enfield-equipped riflemen
hamster.gun.gew98.name: Gew.98 Rifle
hamster.gun.gew98.desc:
The pinnacle of the Mauser bolt-action rifle.
Adopted by the German Empire.
§eThis design inspired many countries to develop their own.
hamster.gun.lugerp08_artillerie.name: P08 Artillery Carbine
hamster.gun.lugerp08_artillerie.desc:
An improved P08 for artillery units.
Designed for specific battlefield needs.
hamster.gun.webley.name: Webley Mk.VI Revolver
hamster.gun.webley.desc:
A highly successful revolver with rapid double-action firing.
§eKnown for its powerful stopping power.
§eReliable in harsh conditions.
hamster.gun.colt1873.name: Colt M1873 'Peacemaker'Revolver
hamster.gun.colt1873.desc:
Colt’s iconic revolver that challenged S&W dominance.
 Became a legendary weapon in history with the saying, 
§eGod made man, but Colt made them equal.
hamster.gun.m1887.name: Winchester M1887 Lever-Action Shotgun
hamster.gun.m1887.desc:
The first successful lever-action shotgun, designed by John Browning.
§e It remains a film icon, despite the lever-action craze fading.
hamster.gun.m1887_hc.name: Winchester M1887 Hand Cannon Shotgun
hamster.gun.m1887_hc.desc: A shortened version of the M1887, designed for concealment and quick firing.
hamster.gun.lebel1886_07c.name: [Special] Lebel 1886/07C Carbine Rifle
hamster.gun.lebel1886_07c.desc: A modification of the Lebel rifle into a cavalry carbine for mounted troops.
hamster.gun.win1894.name: Winchester M1894 Lever-Action Rifle
hamster.gun.win1894.desc:
The most popular hunting rifle of all time.
§e Iconic in Western films alongside the Colt 'Peacemaker'.
hamster.gun.one_barrel.name: Hammer-Action Shotgun
hamster.gun.one_barrel.desc:
A simple, reliable, and inexpensive single-barrel shotgun.
§eFound in nearly every gun shop.
hamster.gun.luger1906.name: Luger M1906 Rifle
hamster.gun.luger1906.desc:
An attempt to apply toggle-lock to a rifle, but a failed experiment.
§eTrapped by its time's infantry weapon ideas.
hamster.gun.lugerp08.name: Luger P08 Pistol
hamster.gun.lugerp08.desc:
Iconic in both World Wars, the first standard-issue semi-automatic.
§eA valuable collectible and battlefield treasure.
hamster.gun.coltm1851.name: Colt M1851 Conversion Revolver
hamster.gun.coltm1851.desc:
The first practical revolver, converted to metal-cased ammo.
§eA powerful weapon since the Walker revolver.
hamster.gun.uppercut.name: [Special] 'Uppercut' Pistol
hamster.gun.uppercut.desc:
A highly modified Colt M1851 with brutal recoil.
§eFeels like the barrel might explode.
hamster.gun.berthier.name: Berthier M1892 Rifle
hamster.gun.berthier.desc:
A cavalry carbine with fast reloading using a 3-round clip.
§eThe 8mm Lebel cartridge made it obsolete.
hamster.gun.sharps.name: Sharps M1874 Sharpshooter Rifle
hamster.gun.sharps.desc:
A long-range rifle, capable of taking down bison with one shot.
§eFamous for the Civil War and Wild West days.
hamster.gun.lebel1886.name: Lebel M1886 Rifle
hamster.gun.lebel1886.desc:
The world’s first standard-issue smokeless powder rifle.
§eBlack powder cartridges were rendered obsolete.
hamster.gun.gras1874.name: Gras 1874 Rifle
hamster.gun.gras1874.desc:
A transitional French rifle, still in use at the start of the war.
§eThe French arsenal was filled with these antiques.
hamster.gun.m1879revolver.name: M1879 'Empire' Revolver
hamster.gun.m1879revolver.desc:
A revolver with powerful rounds but a primitive design.
§eNamed 'Empire,' it failed to keep up with modern times.
hamster.gun.martinihenry.name: Martini-Henry Rifle
hamster.gun.martinihenry.desc:
A classic falling-block rifle used during British colonial expansion.
§eBoth oppressors and oppressed spoke their final words through it.
